alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 2:40PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central DeSoto, northwestern Marshall and northeastern Tate Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 240 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Byhalia, or 12 miles southeast of Olive Branch, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Olive Branch, Byhalia, Lewisburg, Red Banks, Coal Oil Corner, Wakefield, Fairhaven, Alphaba, Victoria, Cockrum, Watson, Handy Corner, New Garden, Miller, Bett and Rockhill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
